intro: Cremastosciadium leucocorymbe, commonly known as the white-capped starwort, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. It is a perennial herb with slender, branched stems that often grow in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, feathery appearance. It is native to Europe and is often found in woodland areas, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the understory.
